criteria: Identification of Uncertainties in the Text
descriptions: No textual evidence is provided, or the evidence provided is completely irrelevant to the analysis.
The textual evidence is minimal, inaccurate, or does not support the analysis.
The textual evidence is partially accurate but weakly supports the analysis.
The textual evidence is generally accurate and supports the analysis, but there are minor inaccuracies or omissions.
The textual evidence is accurate and clearly supports the analysis.
The textual evidence is not only accurate but is also strategically selected to provide the strongest possible support for the analysis.
No inferences are drawn, or the inferences made are illogical and completely unsupported by the text.
The inferences drawn are superficial, lack textual support, or contradict the text.
The inferences drawn are somewhat logical but require more textual support or deeper analysis.
The inferences drawn are logical and have some textual support, but there is room for more nuanced understanding.
The inferences drawn are logical, well-supported by the text, and show a good understanding of the material.
The inferences drawn demonstrate a sophisticated understanding of the text, going beyond the obvious to uncover deeper meanings and implications.
No attempt is made to identify uncertainties or ambiguities in the text.
Uncertainties are mentioned but without any supporting evidence or explanation.
Some uncertainties are identified, but the explanation is superficial or lacks depth.
Uncertainties are identified with reasonable explanations, but some key ambiguities may be overlooked.
Uncertainties are clearly identified and thoroughly explained, showing a strong understanding of the text's complexities.
Demonstrates exceptional insight by identifying subtle uncertainties and exploring their implications with sophisticated reasoning and textual support.
